API_Description: Creates a new child bookmark under the current bookmark root.
API_Description_Reason: The method name 'createChild' suggests that it is used to create a new child element, and since it is part of the 'bookmarkRoot' object, it likely pertains to creating a child bookmark.
Returns_Reason: Since the method is creating a new child, it is reasonable to assume it returns the newly created bookmark object for further manipulation or reference.

cName.description: The name of the new child bookmark to create.
cName.description_reason: The parameter 'cName' is typically used to specify the name of an object being created, in this case, the name of the bookmark.
cName.type_reason: The 'c' prefix in 'cName' suggests it is a string, as is common in naming conventions where 'c' stands for 'character' or 'string'.

cExpr.description: The expression or action associated with the new child bookmark.
cExpr.description_reason: The parameter 'cExpr' likely refers to an expression or action that the bookmark will execute or represent, such as a script or a destination.
cExpr.type_reason: The 'c' prefix in 'cExpr' suggests it is a string, which is typical for expressions or script content.

nIndex.description: The position at which to insert the new child bookmark within the current bookmark root.
nIndex.description_reason: The parameter 'nIndex' is likely used to specify the order or position of the new bookmark among existing children, which is common in methods that insert elements.
nIndex.type_reason: The 'n' prefix in 'nIndex' suggests it is a number, which is appropriate for specifying an index or position.
